behavior.name: scope-enforcement
behavior.summary: Rules for maintaining scope boundaries and preventing scope creep. Every change must be tied to a beads ticket. Agents must only modify files assigned to them.

section.name: orchestrator-level
section.rule: Every change to the codebase must be tied to a beads ticket. If an agent discovers something that needs fixing but is outside the current ticket's scope, report it to the orchestrator â€” never fix it silently.

If the human requests work outside the current ticket during a lifecycle: 1. Acknowledge the request 2. Explain that the current ticket is in progress 3. Offer to create a new ticket for the additional work 4. Continue with the current ticket unless the human explicitly overrides

section.name: agent-level
section.rule: Implementation agents (teammates) must only modify files listed in their sub-task assignment. If an agent discovers that additional files need changes: 1. Do NOT modify the out-of-scope files 2. Complete the in-scope work 3. Report the out-of-scope discovery in the completion message to the orchestrator 4. The orchestrator decides whether to create a follow-up sub-task or a new ticket
